abilities.description: The user can transform their body into bottomless swamp, allowing them to become intangible and avoid physical attacks like other Logia types.
The user can store objects and people within their swamp body, effectively making them disappear into a bottomless swamp dimension.
Caribou uses his swamp body to capture mermaids by pulling them into his body, where they are stored and unable to escape.

weaknesses.description: Susceptible to seawater and Seastone like all Devil Fruit users. Cannot swim and becomes weakened when submerged.

keyMoments.title: Caribou Uses Numa Numa no Mi to Kidnap Mermaids
keyMoments.description: Caribou demonstrates the kidnapping application of his Devil Fruit by capturing Ishilly, Fillonce, and another mermaid into his swamp body.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the sinister potential of the Numa Numa no Mi for criminal activities and establishes Caribou as a threat to Fish-Man Island's mermaid population.

trivia: The Numa Numa no Mi is considered one of the weaker Logia-type Devil Fruits despite its useful storage capabilities.
Caribou uses this fruit primarily for criminal purposes, storing treasure and kidnapping victims.
